tn.ref: the word of Yahweh came
tn.text: "Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Son of man
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:02:01|2:3]].

tn.ref: set your face against
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:04:01|4:3]].

tn.ref: the people of Ammon
tn.text: "the descendants of Ammon" or "those who live in the land of Ammon"

tn.ref: and prophesy against
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:04:06|4:7]].

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh tells Ezekiel what to say to the people of Ammon.

tn.ref: the people of Ammon
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:25:03|25:2]].

tn.ref: Hear the word of the Lord Yahweh
tn.text: "Listen to this message from the Lord Yahweh"

tn.ref: you said, "Aha!"
tn.text: The word "Aha" is a sound people make when they are happy about something. In this case the people were happy because bad things happened to Israel and Judah. AT: "you laughed" or "you cheered"

tn.ref: over my sanctuary when it was profaned
tn.text: "against my sanctuary when the enemy profaned it." AT: "when the enemy army defiled my temple" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: against the land of Israel when it was desolate
tn.text: AT: "when the land of Israel was in ruins"

tn.ref: against the house of Judah when they went into exile
tn.text: AT: "when they took the people of Judah away as slaves."

tn.ref: behold!
tn.text: AT: "look!" or "listen!" or "pay attention to what I am about to tell you!"

tn.ref: I am giving you to a people in the east as their possession
tn.text: "I will cause an army from a land that is east of you to come and conquer you"

tn.ref: They will set up camp against you and set up their tents among you
tn.text: This can be translated as a new sentence: "They will set up tents and live in your country."

tn.ref: the people of Ammon a field for flocks
tn.text: Here "the people of Ammon" refers to the land that belonged to the people of Ammon. AT: "I will make the rest of the land of Ammon a field for flocks." (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: all the contempt within you against the land of Israel
tn.text: AT: "with all of the hatred you feel towards the people who live in Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: behold!
tn.text: AT: "look!" or "listen!" or "pay attention to what I am about to tell you!"

tn.ref: I will strike you with my hand
tn.text: AT: "I will hit you with my powerful hand" or "I will punish you"

tn.ref: and give you as plunder to the nations
tn.text: AT: "and I will cause the nations to come and take everything away from you"

tn.ref: I will cut you off from the peoples ... make you perish from among the countries
tn.text: These phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize Yahweh will completely destroy the people of Ammon so that they are no longer a nation. AT: "I will completely destroy you so that you are no longer a nation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: you will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].

tn.ref: Behold!
tn.text: AT: "Look!" or "Listen!" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you!"

tn.ref: I will open the slopes of Moab, starting at his cities on the border
tn.text: AT: "I will open the path to Moab by destroying the cities on its border."

tn.ref: the splendor of Beth Jeshimoth, Baal Meon, and Kiraiathaim
tn.text: AT: "I will start at the great cities of Beth Jeshimoth, Baal Meon, and Kiraiathaim." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: to the people of the east who have been against the people of Ammon
tn.text: AT: "I will send the same army from the nations in the east who attacked Ammon."

tn.ref: I will give them up as a possession so that the people of Ammon will not be remembered among the nations.
tn.text: AT: "I will cause the armies to conquer Ammon so that no one will even remember them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: they will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]].

tn.ref: I will strike Edom with my hand
tn.text: See how you translated the similar phrase "I will strike you with my hand" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:25:06|25:07]].

tn.ref: from Teman to Dedan
tn.text: These are two cities at opposite ends of Edom. This means that God will destroy all of Edom. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: They will fall by the sword
tn.text: The word "fall" represents being killed and "sword" refers to battle. AT: "Their enemies will kill them with their swords" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: I will lay my vengeance upon Edom by the hand of my people Israel
tn.text: AT: "I will use my people Israel to take revenge against the people of Edom"

tn.ref: they will do to Edom according to my anger and my fury
tn.text: AT: "they will show Edom my anger and fury" or "they will punish Edom according to my anger and fury against the people of Edom"

tn.ref: my anger and my fury
tn.text: The word "fury" means basically the same thing as and intensifies the word "anger." AT: "my furious anger" or "my extreme anger" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: they will know my vengeance
tn.text: AT: "the people of Edom will know that I have taken revenge against them"

tn.ref: this is the Lord Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: AT: "This is what the Lord Yahweh declares" or "This is what the Lord says will happen"

tn.ref: The Philistines have taken vengeance with malice and from within themselves they tried to destroy Judah again and again
tn.text: AT: "Because the Philistines hated the people in Judah and tried to take revenge against them again and again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Behold!
tn.text: AT: "Look!" or "Listen!" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you!"

tn.ref: I will reach out with my hand against the Philistines
tn.text: AT: "I will turn my powerful hand against the Philistines" or "I will turn my great power against the Philistines"

tn.ref: I will cut off
tn.text: AT: "I will destroy" or "I will get rid of" (UDB)

tn.ref: Cherethites
tn.text: AT: "The people of Chereth." This is a people that lived in Philistia (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: they will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated the similar phrase "you will know that I am Yahweh" in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:06:06|6:7]]
